page.title: 15Farm Shop: (Balfron Parish)
page.content:
Customers can buy{frozen vegetables etc. but the bulk of trade is in{meat, both fresh and frozen. Much is the {farm's own produce}but further stock is obtained from Glasgow and Paisley markets. Meat is hung in one of the two chills to mature for up to three weeks, then jointed packed and labelled in the preparation room and frozen in a blast freeser. Customers, (mainly housewives buying in bulk for home freezers), are served in a front shop, where there are nine freezers.
The shop has considerable{custom}from {E.Kilbride and Helensburgh}as well as {locally.}It is open six days a week from 8am to 5pm. The running of this enterprise needs a{wife's help}for clerical work and packing. A full-time {butcher and trainee assistant}are also employed.
